children.name: Fundamental attribution error
children.description: Tendency to believe that what people do reflections who they are (under-emphasis of situational explanations).

children.name: Group attribution error
children.description: Generalising to groups based on the characteristics of individuals.

children.name: Halo effect
children.description: Evaluation augmented by previous judgements.

children.name: History bias
children.description: Inaccuracies in data due to historical unfairness.

children.name: Implicit associations and stereotypes
children.description: Unconscious mental representations of objects in memory.

children.name: Out-group homogeneity
children.description: 'They are alike; we are diverse'.

children.name: Overgeneralisation
children.description: Conclusion reached on the basis of too few data points.

children.name: Prejudice
children.description: Preconceptions based on one’s perceived group membership.

children.name: Reporting bias
children.description: Tendency to under-report the information available.

children.name: Selection bias
children.description: Non-random sample of a population.

children.name: Stereotypical bias
children.description: Unfounded beliefs about certain groups of people.

children.name: Anecdotal fallacy
children.description: Drawing conclusions based on non-scientific evidence.

children.name: Bias blind spot
children.description: Failing to see the impact of bias on own judgement.

children.name: Choice-supportive bias
children.description: Ascribing positive attributes to a preselected option.

children.name: Confirmation bias
children.description: Favour information that supports own beliefs and values.

children.name: Experimenter bias
children.description: Making research decisions to support a mentally predetermined outcome.

children.name: Illusion of validity and narrative fallacy
children.description: Patterns are often illusions, spurious; but tendency to form narratives around them.

children.name: Insensitivity to sample size
children.description: Neglect of the fact that variation is more likely in small samples.

children.name: Intergroup bias
children.description: Favouring members of one’s in-group over out-group.

children.name: Neglect of probability
children.description: Disregarding prior probabilities.

children.name: Non-sampling error
children.description: Data entry errors, biased survey questions, non-responses, false information, faulty analysis, random combinations thereof, etc.

children.name: Sampling error
children.description: Overgeneralisation based on a sample misrepresentative of a population.

children.name: Subjective validation
children.description: Accepting something if it presents to them in a personal and positive way.

children.name: Restriction bias
children.description: What model is able to represent.

children.name: Preference bias
children.description: What representation the algorithm prefers.
